channel.title: Post Cards (Posts about To: Grace Chandler)

item.title: From: J.M. Jones, To: Grace Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: J.M. Jones, To: Grace Chandler Mailed From: St. Louis on June 19, 1913

Oliver Type Writer Building 812 Pine Street. St. Louis June 19/1913

Miss Grace Chandler, Pearl, Illinois

Dear Miss: We are in receipt f your letter of June 18th in which you have asked for commissions due on sale to J.W. Smith and H. Owings. The commission on the order of J.W. Smith is due, and check is being sent you under separate cover today. The commission on the sale to Herbert Owings will not be due until April 7th, 1914, at which time you will receive your commission check in accordance with the contract which was made with you. Yours very truly, J.W. Jones Assistant Manager

item.title: From: O.F.R. ,To: Grace Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: O.F.R., To: Grace Chandler Mailed From: Iowa on May 18, 1913 Picture Info: Burlington Hotel, Burlington, Iowa

Miss Grace Chandler Pearl, Illinois CTA

5/18/13 Received letter. No, I won't tell. Will answer soon. Some hotel, eh? O.F.R. x my room (x on the picture marked where the person's room is)

item.title: From: Unknown, To: Grace Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Unknown, To: Grace Chandler Mailed From: Pearl, Illinois on November 28, 1912

My Dear Gracie, Not so much fun about that as there was in the beginning of your letter. But then the old era is so darn full of trains tonight, I had to come down and relieve the Opr tonight, while he went to dinner Ha. First my dear I want to mention tomorrow night. This weather one "guy" can't have much luck on a speeder and that way I'd have to come over if I came. So if all is suitable with you I'd rather make it Friday instead of Thurs eve and I'll come on 33 and back on the Chicago train and that way you'll not have to ask me to leave at ten for I'll have to go shortly before. Grace you know those trains are always some last an I'll get to stay until your tired of me. Yes about your friend Mr. Lienhatrdt, I sat with him coming home on 12 Monday. He also told me he was with you at a party other night. made me kinda sore too cause I never get any invitations to the parties. Ha. Yes it was really me he saw on 12 - true I would have enjoyed a couple of days more at home but my dear there is seemingly no rest in sight and I must also add that truly, the most restful periods in my "career" is, when I am spending my evenings with you. And I look forward anxiously to those evenings. I wonder if I will be fortunate enough to spend a few more of them. Yes! When you mentioned that great subject (candy), seems to me as though I can recall a bet made some weeks ago, where in you were looser? And am counting big on tasting some real good fudge when you make it. Do remember me. And you are contemplating going to St. Louis eh! Looks like you'd put it off until next Saturday night and let me go along. We will take in a show and look around some. Honest - for I need to do the shopping stunt too. Here's my trip Saturday- to Maybrew on 15- Marshall on 18 Sunday Slater on 24 Sunday-12 onto Roadhouse and back on 19- 8:30 am - Monday. Had a great time, met some dandy fellows at Marshall, also saw some girl friends. Wish you might have been along for Missouri (Saline County)  is the place for fun. Ask "Jake" will mail this on #15 tomorrow and trust it will reach you in due time also meet your approval. Let here have a card on 16 dearie if ok for me to come up Friday evening. Darn if we have been together for 4 months. Save me a kiss too will you? French? Yes. You going to meet the train - 33? yes. No news here so I will leave it with you. Too bad about Smith. Ha. All yours, (Unreadable Scribble) 8:30 1st Wednesday

item.title: From: Ruby Chandler, To: Grace Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Ruby Chandler, To: Grace Chandler Mailed From: Wichita, Kansas on September 8, 1911 Postcard Info: Embossed Comic Series No. 5475. Copyrighted 1911 by E.J. Haffner

Miss Grace Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Dearest Grace: Won't you even send me a card? Did you get those from Carmen? We received Bess' letter after I mailed Papa's. Glad to low she is doing so well. We went all over to the new high school today. It is just great. We're so glad Martin is to tie those studies. Write soon. Lovingly, Ruby

item.title: From: Ruth, To: Grace Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Ruth, To: Grace Chandler Mailed From: Mount Pulaski, Ill on July 27, 1911 Picture Info: Court House in which Lincoln Practiced Law. Mt. Pulaski, Ill.

Miss Grace Chandler Pearl, Ill. Pike County

Still telling me about Coca Cola and ambiguous - know you fought it, please you keep those sisters secure in the house. Now suppose your satisfied but think of me and how I miss them. You better enjoy them and make up with them for me for missing them too. Wish I had some charming sisters, too. Ruth

item.title: From: Unknown, To: Grace Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Unknown, To: Grace Chandler Mailed From: Lincoln, Illinois on July 25, 1911 Picture Info: Scene Chantangua Lake, Lincoln, Illinois - 11046

Miss Grace Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Dearest, One of those fascinating letters of L. Chandler. How can you resist it? Hug the girls for me. Am writing a bunch of those. We are having winter here now. Will write a lot next time. Words of love from me.

item.title: From: Bess Chandler, To: Grace Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Bess Chandler, To: Grace Chandler Mailed From: Kampsville, Illinois on May 2, 1911

Miss Grace Chandler 253 N. Estille Ave. Wichita, Kansas

Dear Grace, When are you going to answer? You ought to see me now. Will write later. Bess

item.title: From: A.F.R., To: Grace Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: A.F.R., To: Grace Chandler Mailed From: Detroit, Illinois on December 21, 1910 Postcard Info: Printed in Germany Picture Info: "Wishing you a Merry Christmas"

Miss Grace Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Detroit The same old wish to you too. A.F.R.

item.title: From: Jon, To: Grace Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: Jon, To: Grace Chandler Mailed From: Vandalia, MO. on October 25, 1910 Picture Info: Bryan Parade, Vandalia Corn Carnival

Miss Grace Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Do you care to see me real bad? If do, will come any time. Jon

item.title: From: Russell Bauer, To: Grace Chandler
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
From: , To: Grace Chandler Mailed From: St. Louis, MO on September 19, 1910

Miss Grace Chandler Pearl, Illinois

Hello girlie, I am in St. Louis now and you must come and see me when in the city. Is Ruby home now? Give her my regards. Tell her to come also. Have some new shows. Wish you were here to sing. Lovingly, Russell Bauer
